title: Strategies to Improve Satisfaction with Mobile-Based Science Learning Environments: Focus on Experiments, Observations, and Evidence Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational scientific knowledge (experimental design, variable control, scientific methodology), online learning experience, understanding of data measurement and analysis techniques, and ability to derive evidence-based conclusions
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service and current teachers, featuring a high-intensity microlearning program with professionals participating in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Emphasizes experimental, observational, and data analysis skills applicable to science education settings. Focuses particularly on variable control, evidence collection, and optimizing the scientific inquiry process.

learning_goals: Learners can apply metacognitive self-regulation strategies in online environments to improve the efficiency of measuring and analyzing scientific experiment data by over 20%, while strengthening their ability to derive evidence-based conclusions through variable control.

Learners can enhance their self-efficacy in scientific inquiry processes with peers and instructors by over 15% using mobile-based interactive technologies, while cultivating collaborative problem-solving skills for hypothesis verification.

Learners can identify motivational factors (e.g., hypothesis verification, variable control, data pattern analysis) through scientific task value assessments and incorporate them into learning design.

Learners can improve satisfaction metrics by over 30% by applying mobile-optimized science learning design principles (e.g., experiment simulations, data visualization, integrated analysis tools) and acquire systematic observation methods for scientific inquiry.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
